website_summaries.verdict: If you need 1 toy to please 2 children at the same time, this stomp rocket fits the bill.
pros: Allows 2 kids to stomp and shoot at the same time
Shoots very high – up to 200 feet
Rockets can shoot over and over again
Cuts down on the fighting over the toy when 2 kids can do it at once
cons: Only comes with 4 rockets which, given the double launch capacity, may make you want to have some add-on rockets

customer_reviews.title: Really fun, low tech outdoor toy
customer_reviews.text: My kids (4 & 2) love these. Also some neighbor kids (6 & 9) walked by and also loved them. Careful not to bend over to reload one rocket while your excited child is stomping the other one... but I’ve been hit at pretty close range and it didn’t hurt. So... safe for all ages! Ha. We had the original version for a couple of years before the rockets tore apart (likely because of destructo-baby). These are a slightly different design but work just as well. Note that my husband bought a different brand of the same idea at a major toy store, and they barely flew, so we returned them. Get this specific brand for sure.
customer_reviews.author: HBP

customer_reviews.title: Huge Hit!!!
customer_reviews.text: Huge Hit!!! I bought this for a church picnic. I thought we needed more activities and I’m so glad I bought it. Everyone loved this thing! It took 2 seconds to set up. Seems to be decent quality. This toy was enjoyed by kids and adults alike. When the adults/big kids use the stomp rocket those rockets really fly! My 3 year old said the rockets were his favorite part of the picnic and we had a bounce house and face painting too. I’ve been asked by several parents where I bought it. I know quite a few children will be getting this toy for holidays and birthdays. Thank you for a great entertaining toy!
customer_reviews.author: T. Koble

customer_reviews.title: Fun for Everyone!!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this toy for my nephew's 3rd birthday and he absolutely loves it. For the weeks following his birthday he refused to come inside because he loved playing with this toy so much. My nieces and nephews (ages 3, 6, 8, and 12) all loved playing with the dueling stomp rocket, and so did the adults!!!!! The initial set up took all of 2 minutes, almost all ages are able to refill the rockets by themselves and anyone can participate!! The initial toy only comes with Red rockets so if you purchase the Blue rockets it'll make the distance competitions fun and easy to judge! Awesome purchase!! Would definitely purchase again!!!
customer_reviews.author: rfrannie

customer_reviews.title: My kids LOVE this product
customer_reviews.text: My kids LOVE this product. Too bad the rockets are made of such poor, flimsy material. If you have a child under 4, make sure you tell them to handle the rockets with care. This product was taken to my in-laws as its an outdoor toy and we don't have much room here at home. A week later (and after being used for about 2 total hours), the fins on the rockets started to rip and one rocket was bent. You can tape the fins back on, but once the rockets start to bend, they won't go on the launcher properly and therefore won't launch correctly. Again, my kids love the product, it just won't last long.
customer_reviews.author: Nick F.

customer_reviews.title: Great toy very sturdy
customer_reviews.text: We got these for a rocket birthday party. We have owned the stomp rocket junior but often the set up would adjust itself at a new angle or the base would come out of place and fall apart. This solves those problems. The base is so stable. We had a party and had kids running and jumping to launch rockets without a single adjustment needed the whole time. The kids played and played. We love it. We even made paper rockets as a craft then launched them as well. It even will fit our rockets from our junior set so we are very happy with this setup.
customer_reviews.author: Geeks Wife

customer_reviews.title: Boys LOVE them.... me.... not so much....
customer_reviews.text: so my 8 year olds were playing with this and got a rocket stuck in a tree... my genius self decided to move the other rocket under that one to try and shoot it out.... however when i was positioning it my son stomped on it and shot the dart into my eye... from about a foot away.... broken glasses, and now im having to go to the doctor for a possible detached retina.... sooooo have fun just dont be like me! lol
customer_reviews.author: ashley

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic toy enjoyed by all age groups
customer_reviews.text: My daughters (3 and 5 years old) love this. They have so much fun stomping on the launch pad and watching their rocket go. Our next door neighbors enjoy blasting it off as well (8-11 years old). The product isn’t made of high quality materials, but is fairly inexpensive for the fun enjoyed by all ages. We’ve had the product for about 4 months and it is still working great. We put duct tape at the base/stand for better stabilization, but that was the only modification needed to continue the fun enjoyed by our daughters.
customer_reviews.author: G.M.

customer_reviews.title: A complete and total hit with the kids
customer_reviews.text: Oh, man, I cannot say enough about how much my two girls and their cousins love this set. They got it for Christmas, and it's still a favorite two months later. The whole family got a kick out of it. My favorite stomp rocket moment was when my 80-year-old dad suddenly shot out of his office at the speed of light and started scrambling in the hallway -- my mom and kids and I did not realize it was rocket business and we were like WHAT IS GOING ON?! And then he stomped that rocket like the fate of America depended on it -- right as my sister opened the bathroom door. I nearly peed my pants laughing at them.
customer_reviews.author: Kimberly Thomas

customer_reviews.title: Toddler, child and parent approved
customer_reviews.text: WHat's not to love about a stomp rocket? This is fun because two people can do it at once and it comes with 4 rockets. It's kind of awkward to store because of the long hoses and how it connects to the base. I don't really want to take everything apart every time to store. There is no flexibility either in being able to angle where the rocket aims, as I've seen with other stomp rockets. These go straight up. Overall though, lots of fun.
customer_reviews.author: Cristina

customer_reviews.title: Great energy burning gift!
customer_reviews.text: Great gift for our 2 grandsons. Easy to assemble and take apart for storage. Our six year old was quickly able to launch his rockets higher and higher each time. Our 4 year old had a harder time landing on the pump, but got the hang of it and enjoyed it as well. I am sure their next visit he will have the technic down. I think his rain boots (on the wrong feet) vs his brothers nice new tennis shoes might have had a bit to do with his balance. In the end it was a hit and well worth the price.
customer_reviews.author: Oligodendroglioma Fund

customer_reviews.title: Such a winner
customer_reviews.text: stomp rockets are go to for our family. We love them both in our house, and as birthday gifts for early elementary kids. Even adults enjoy jumping on the stomp rockets to see how high they can go. My only complaint is the launching stand seems to fail at times. After being used a lot, sometimes it bends and it's hard to keep straight. Overall I love stomp rockets!
customer_reviews.author: D J Taylor

customer_reviews.title: Kids and adults love it!
customer_reviews.text: Works great! Just remember to use in the grass and not on concrete (driveway, etc). We used it on the driveway for about 30 minutes the first time, and we found that it was starting to scratch up the bottom of the yellow jumping platforms. We’re afraid that holes may start to form if we continued to use it on the concrete, which would obviously make it useless as the air inside those yellow platforms would escape and no longer push up through the tubes and launch the rockets. So, use on the grass!
customer_reviews.author: Marty and Lindsay

customer_reviews.title: fun for all ages
customer_reviews.text: This work as advertised. They did end up in a predictable pattern so we could cotnrol were they landed. I would recomend some adult supervision if near a street. I think the highest we got it was around 30 feet. I wasn't expecting much but the kids were entertained. Kids from 3 to 9 for over an hour. Definately a hit!! The rockets were light weight so the plastic started to show distress after one use, but I think that it allows them to be safer. I don't think they could damage much if they hit anything important.
customer_reviews.author: nana nana boo boo

customer_reviews.title: These are super fun!
customer_reviews.text: These are super fun! I didn't expect that they would be very good quality or be much fun but they were a big hit at our daughter's birthday party. The rockets go REALLY high--A couple times they went into the neighbors' yard and landed on our roof so make sure you have some room! My favorite part about these are that they're "Dueling Rockets" so two kids can compete with each other to see whose goes farther! It was fun for the grown-ups, too!
customer_reviews.author: joyfulgirl68

customer_reviews.title: Such a great toy!!!
customer_reviews.text: What a great improvement to add a dual rocket to this toy. We purchased one for my son 20+ years ago and it was well loved. I ordered this for his daughters and it's lots of fun. It doesn't fly as high as the original one did probably because the tips are heavier. But they still go far enough to delight the kids.
customer_reviews.author: Lynne B

customer_reviews.title: Fun exercise for all ages!
customer_reviews.text: Yeah...these rocket launchers are great fun for people of all ages, even the youngest kids can play. But as the adults, don't think you'll just sit on the sidelines watching the kids play. No...due to the design of this cool toy, they topple over continuously and the connection tubes always have to be reset in the knotches that are supposed to hold them in place. But don't let that discourage you, it's worth the effort for all the fun that is had. Watch out for trees because the rockets fly high and they make a little popping sound when they launch. So get some rocket launchers especially if you need fun things to do at a party!
customer_reviews.author: Cs

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use! If only they all four worked!
customer_reviews.text: They are very easy to use. My 3 year old was able to use them and my 6 year old can launch them so much higher. But simple enough a 3 year old can do it. The blue rocket's may have been defective. They didnt work well, like the plastic tubing was made a bit too small. The yellow two worked great though and they had fun for hours!
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie Flood

customer_reviews.title: Go-to gift!
customer_reviews.text: This is a go-to birthday present for my kids' friends, especially ones with siblings. The rockets shoot up impressively high but somehow the strength is still not strong enough to cause injury for the occasion anxious kid who stops before someone is finished loading. I can't vouch for longevity beyond a few months yet, but so far everyone we've given it to, boys & girls, 3 yr-9 yrs has loved it!
customer_reviews.author: Curil

customer_reviews.title: Incredible Toy for all Ages!
customer_reviews.text: These stomp rockets are amazing! Whenever we take them to the park, it is not long before all of the kids in the park are coming over with interest and before long they are all playing together. They shoot very high up into the air, easy to put together. We've even purchased one to give to my sons friend for his birthday because he loves playing with ours so much. Worth the money - these will be a big hit for almost any kid!
customer_reviews.author: TowerChief

customer_reviews.title: Fun for one use with kids under 8
customer_reviews.text: I bought this because of the good reviews. The plastic was so thin my husband tore it when trying to assemble it. It does not come with any instructions so he had to go off the picture on the box. He ended up wrapping the tubes with duct tape and it worked decently. One tube was torn the other was fine. Kids ages 3-8 were using it they loved it but it’s so fragile it’s not worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Aubri Lyn Edwards

customer_reviews.title: Skip it. It’s not worth the money or your aggravation.
customer_reviews.text: Don’t buy this. I figured it’s an inexpensive toy for kids to play with while we are SIP for the corona but it was annoying to put together and it barely ever works most of the time. I constantly have to interfere with it to get it to work. 1 star because i have to give it one. I would not recommend and would not buy as a gift.
customer_reviews.author: Jeni

customer_reviews.title: way better than original
customer_reviews.text: Stomp rockets are great toys in general. This is a big improvement over the original because the base does not fall over and have to be reassembled all the time (BY ADULTS). Also two kids can do it at once, cutting down on some of the arguments over whose turn it is and intervention (BY ADULTS). In other words, the adults can watch from the sidelines while the kids work it out and have fun, which is what I want in a toy. Lest you think, "I only have one kid so I should buy the original," NO, these things attract kids like flies to honey.
customer_reviews.author: H. Norrod

customer_reviews.title: Tons of fun so far!
customer_reviews.text: Grandkids, age 7 and almost 4, had a blast with the dual Stomp Rockets! Gave it a workout in one place, then dragged it to another place in the yard and had more fun there! They discovered that they could change the angle on the launcher so that it wouldn't shoot straight up in the air. That way, finding out whose went the farthest, not just the highest. Never had the "single" Stomp Rocket, and saw that there were; "...too lightweight". and "launcher falls over" complaints. Not with this one. The kids played with the dual, off and on, all afternoon...and had no issue with stability. Lots of fun!
customer_reviews.author: J. Gardner

customer_reviews.title: Missing Pieces
customer_reviews.text: I got this as a present. There were missing pieces where it made this completely unusable. The child was very sad not being able to play with it after opening the gift. Very disappointed and a huge waste of money! The pictures attached is all that came in the box.
customer_reviews.author: Danielle

customer_reviews.title: Great game for all ages
customer_reviews.text: Kids and grownups both enjoyed this toy. They should come with more rockets. We lost 2 the first day. Refills are pretty expensive for only 2 rockets. Lots of fun though. I got the dual one thinking they could race. After buying the party pack one, we’ve decided the dual isn’t as good as the single. Probably because of the stand. The dual causes the hose to end. We preferred the single one and they like taking turns so while this one is a great idea, if we did it all over again, we’d of just bought the party pack. Wonderful fun for ALL AGES!!!
customer_reviews.author: Grammy

customer_reviews.title: BEST Stomp Rocket kit....
customer_reviews.text: Anyone who has struggled with the old style tripod launch base knows it ruins the experience. The old style base would fall apart... This is the answer. It is SO much sturdier. And as a bonus the launch pads can be angled to actual control the direction of the launch. Then add the fact you have side by side launch pads on one structure. This is truly genius! Foolproof construction that makes the stomp rockets FUN! This is by far the best Stomp Rocket launch pad format!
customer_reviews.author: CapeCodBeachFront

customer_reviews.title: Standard air rockets
customer_reviews.text: These are fun but not sure if our kids are just rough on things but the materials that the rockets are made our of isn't the most durable. The plastic at the bottom of each rocket that slides over the launcher isn't very thick and even after a week of use it is starting to bend and that makes it harder to slide over the launcher. I'm guessing the plastic may crack after too much bending but we'll see. Stay tuned.
customer_reviews.author: TheGiftyGirl

customer_reviews.title: Fun for all ages
customer_reviews.text: We first saw stomp rockets at the park last summer and the kids who brought it were kind enough to share with my kids. So they got their own set! It’s been great fun in the wide open parks we have around here. Even grown ups can enjoy the fun! The rockets can get pretty high up in the air, which is entertaining. And you can finagle it to shoot forward and have contests of who can rocket further. Truly fun!
customer_reviews.author: djCharly

customer_reviews.title: Not a long-lasting toy
customer_reviews.text: Not impressed. For an award winning toy I expected a lot more. We gave it to our six year old for his birthday and it only lasted four stomps. The plastic tubing is cheap and thin, the stomp pads are thin, and the rockets fell apart. It’s too bad because it looked awesome and the few times the rockets flew, they went really high! Five stars for the fun but had to take off for the lack of quality and long term fun. For $20 we can go to a home improvement store and make our own fun with supplies there. Just way less convenient.
customer_reviews.author: TexasEight

customer_reviews.title: Kids love it
customer_reviews.text: We attended a kids summer activity group Via the library and during one of the breaks they had this toy and all the kids went crazy for it. Had to buy it and it’s even fun for adults just be careful the darts can go flying very far especially if it’s a breeze outside. You can buy extra darts for it too incase that happens.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: As fun as it appears
customer_reviews.text: Too many times I buy toys for my kids that are decidedly less fun irl, versus as "seen on tv". These stomp rockets do not fall into this category and has provided days of fun since Christmas morning. It is built solidly (aside from the fins on the foam rockets) with the *stomp pad* (made up the name) being a high quality silicone/rubber material that stands up to jumps from both kids an adults alike. I rate it a solid 5 stars for price, ease of use and quality.
customer_reviews.author: Devon

customer_reviews.title: 5 - 7 year old grandson loves it!
customer_reviews.text: My grandson was 5 when we bought this & he played by himself most often. He is now 7 and playing with friends. It's still a hit. They are made of foam, so don't expect the arrows to hold up too long if a child plays rough. However, they sell replacement arrows at a reasonable price, so it is a great buy. I did NOT receive a free product or any kind of discount for this review.
customer_reviews.author: Linn

customer_reviews.title: Best Birthday Gift for Three Year Old!
customer_reviews.text: One of the best birthday presents I have ever gotten my son so far! He's actually only three, and while it did take several tries at first, he figured out pretty quickly how to jump on it hard enough. He seriously plays with this for at least an hour at a time. Highly recommend for anyone wanting to get their kids outside! Even works inside for little ones if you have vaulted ceilings, since they can't launch it super high.
customer_reviews.author: ZTBear

customer_reviews.title: My toddlers LOVE it
customer_reviews.text: Decided to order the Dueling version of the Stomp rocket after reading reviews that it is better than the single- and it is pretty awesome. Not sure why other reviewers said the Rockets have fallen apart- they seem pretty well made to me. The only issue so far is with the yellow stomp pads that attach to the accordian tubing that leads to the rocket launcher. They do not go on tightly, so when you stomp on the yellow pad- they detach from the tubes. So we taped them with duct tape and that seems to have done the trick. The kids LOVE competing to see who's rocket goes higher!
customer_reviews.author: LDSCOLLO

customer_reviews.title: Always a great gift
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my nephews 5th birthday and it was a huge hit. Over the years I have given many kids a stomp rocket and my own kids loved theirs. This one is particularly great with two stompers. Great for friends to work together or little brother in this case. Fun fun fun. Never gets old. perfect for kids of all ages but especially the little one. I Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: mom of 2 boys

customer_reviews.title: Hours of fun!!!!
customer_reviews.text: We took this gem on a recent camping trip and the kids LOVED IT! Better than the single rocket launcher because everyone got to have their own rocket! The fins on the rockets themselves are kind of flimsy and one rocket did break in an unfortunate foot vs rocket incident but I just ordered some replacements for the next trip and we are good to go. I highly recommend this toy for active kiddos (the adults enjoyed it too).
customer_reviews.author: natco

customer_reviews.title: Great outdoor fun for little kids and their grownups.
customer_reviews.text: Got these after playing with the single rocket version at a friend’s house. My almost 6 year old LOVES trying to beat his record or his dad and it’s perfect for outdoor play dates which are on the safe end of the COVID risk spectrum. Keeps him and his 3 year old neighbor entertained longer than most any other toy or activity.
customer_reviews.author: I do my research.

customer_reviews.title: Awesome toy but rockets break too easily
customer_reviews.text: Second time buying one of these. Kids LOVE it, which is awesome. Easy and fun outdoor toy! Only gave 3 stars though because all the rockets were broken within a week. The plastic shafts on this set were flimsy and easy to break. We taped up a couple and tried reusing but it was not worth the effort. I love the product, just wish this round had lasted longer. I only plan to buy foam rockets in the future... nothing with a thin plastic tube.
customer_reviews.author: Ellen w

customer_reviews.title: Grandson loves it
customer_reviews.text: The only draw back is the yellow set fits to tight so is hard to launch. if they made the opening just a fraction bigger they would be prefect. My grandson is 2 and learned fast how to launch these , he loved that it is a 2 launcher
customer_reviews.author: Debra Greene

customer_reviews.title: Really fun!
customer_reviews.text: My 5 and 6 year old love this toy! Works wonderfully, especially in an empty parking lot or a wide driveway. Typically they go straight up and don't tend to drift too far away (we were worried about them landing on someone's roof). The rockets themselves are pretty cheaply made and break within the first few uses.
customer_reviews.author: Kran515

customer_reviews.title: Love this toy
customer_reviews.text: We have had stomp rockets with the older grandson before but since his little brother likes to hop, decided on getting a new set for our house. Fairly quick shipping. Have not opened yet as the kids have not been here but from our previous set I can tell you this is a great birthday or Christmas gift for the the whole family and especially kids of any age. Even our college guys love them.
customer_reviews.author: Deborah B. Furman

customer_reviews.title: Simple and fun
customer_reviews.text: We got this for a friend's 7-year old and he loved it more, initially, than a light saber and Nerf gun (kid LOVES Nerf guns, too) -- I think because it's so quick to assemble and you can jump right into playing it, and with others. I think that's it major selling point is that it can be played "competitively" with kids :)
customer_reviews.author: Ryan C. Atkins

customer_reviews.title: Super Fun For Kids and Occasional Adults
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for a double birthday party so that all the kids could use it. The best $21 I ever spent on a toy. My nieces and nephew (3.5y, 7y, 9y) played with this for an hour and a half straight, occasionally cycling in aunts, uncles, and grandparents to see whose stomp rocket would go higher. Then they started putting plastic cups and other items on the tubes to see if they could launch them. The kids could easily reload the rockets themselves and they mostly went straight up in the air and landed nearby so the kids could collect them. 100% would recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Amanda

customer_reviews.title: Doesn’t go anywhere near 200 feet.
customer_reviews.text: The yellow launch pad doesn’t stay on, the blue pipe and my kid is over trying to make it go higher. Will be returning it.
customer_reviews.author: Jenee

customer_reviews.title: Kids LOVED IT!
customer_reviews.text: This was a huge hit with the kids! These little rockets can really fly! All of the kids in my homeschool community loved this toy as an addition to our studies about space missions. I am glad we bought a couple extra packs of the rockets b/c the kids were in lining up for their turns. This held up well again 60 kids trying their stomp several times each. It is now at home with my children & they love it. Very good buy! Lots of fun.
customer_reviews.author: Crystal

customer_reviews.title: Fun for toddlers too
customer_reviews.text: My 3 yr old and 1.5 yr old love this. Safe for inside if you have a toddler proof house already. One gotcha - if you let the rockets get stuck too far down on the launcher poles they require a lot of force to launch. It is best if you barley set them on the launcher pole so kids have no trouble launching them.
customer_reviews.author: Zachary Hartnett

customer_reviews.title: No where near 200 feet, but super fun.
customer_reviews.text: Okay, I'm a 200 lb male and I jumped on this thing with every ounce of my Awesomness. Did that for 2 reasons 1) will it break? No, very well made. 2) 200 feet, really? No, 60-75 feet MAX. These are cool but kids lost interest after about 20 jumps. Just goes up and comes down. Pretty repetitive for a 5 and 2 year old.
customer_reviews.author: Topher

customer_reviews.title: Best Toy You Will Ever Buy!
customer_reviews.text: So much fun! 3 year old and 18 month old played with this over and over again. Best investment I have made in a toy so far. I wish you could aim the rocket (this one only goes straight up) BUT the base on this one is awesome, very steady. The problem with the other, single rocket version that you can aim, is that the base is a cheap piece of trash that fell apart between each stomp. Which is why I chose this one..it really is a ton of fun!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Alot of fun
customer_reviews.text: WE LIVE IT 😘 This is a great outside toy for spring and Summer and fall. I of course purchased it and Christmas time and when it wasn't too cold weeks ago we took it out. My sister her so my daughter and I love taking turns. I purchased two and gave one to my co-workers son who loved it as well. My sister was surprised how much fun it was.
customer_reviews.author: theresa featherstone

customer_reviews.title: This won’t last more then a few months.
customer_reviews.text: You really get what you paid. I’m so sad. We just received it. Played with it a handful of times and now one rocket is broken. Since air is released thru the puncture it won’t shoot up. Now we only have 3 rockets left, and we’ve only used three days. The concept is great, my kids are loving it but this won’t last thru summer due to the cheep plastic material.
customer_reviews.author: ana cantu

customer_reviews.title: Fun and better than expected
customer_reviews.text: Bought these for my kids' birthday and liked the idea of two kids being able to launch at the same time. Ended up being a pretty cool gift! They love stomping and competing to see how high they can get it. Funny thing is that when the (adult) neighbors are over, everyone wants to stomp on it! Pretty cool toy and it has held up well so far.
customer_reviews.author: AmyO

customer_reviews.title: New and Improved!
customer_reviews.text: We had the older version of this which was a lot of fun, but was not stable. We would have to keep setting it upright again and again while trying to play. This one solves that problem totally!! Keeps our grandchildren ages 3 and 8 entertained for quite a while. Would have given this product a 5 star had we not had to add duct tape to keep the "stompers" attached to the hose. Would still buy - a very entertaining toy!
customer_reviews.author: Suzie

customer_reviews.title: PERFECT gift for active kids!!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my 2- and 4-year old nephews, and two years later this is STILL one of their favorite outdoor toys! They live in northern Minnesota, and they use this year-round and burn lots of energy chasing the rockets around their yard. If you're debating between the single or the double rocket stomp, get the double because it's even more fun to do with a friend. And adults can play, too!
customer_reviews.author: Brenda

customer_reviews.title: Fun!
customer_reviews.text: This is so fun to play with. My only complaint is the hose comes off the part you stomp on, so you have to keep attaching it or tape it together. It only takes a second to reattach, just annoying. We even took this on vacation and had a blast with the kids.
customer_reviews.author: Kath Magee

customer_reviews.title: Great fun!!
customer_reviews.text: We were at our neighborhood party and so several children using the Single stomp rocket. I ordered the double stomp rocket for my six-year-old autistic grandson. Not only was he, but we, the adults had a blast using that. Held up very well to my 200 pound son jumping on it! Highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: DE

customer_reviews.title: Great outdoor fun!
customer_reviews.text: Really fun! My kids are 7, 4, and 18 months and we love this toy. After 6 months, it's still a favorite when we play outside. The only reason I can't give it 5 stars is because the missiles break easily. The kids love launching it so much, I don't mind that I've had to wrap them up with tape.
customer_reviews.author: Katie

customer_reviews.title: Good and fun activity; rockets need to be made from a stronger plastic
customer_reviews.text: Great toy for kids and adults. The main components are strong and sturdy enough to withstand the abuse of jumping. But the kids were not careful or caring about the rockets - so they got broken/cracked in 3 months. Boys are rough so these rockets should be made from a stiff plastic.
customer_reviews.author: L. Myers

customer_reviews.title: great outdoor fun!
customer_reviews.text: My grandchildren, their mother and I all had a blast with this toy. It was really cold out the third day we had this and we couldn’t resist going out to play with this again anyway. Easy set up, lots of fun, great price. I would order again for certain. Maybe I’ll get the stunt plain version.
customer_reviews.author: Fredrick s.

customer_reviews.title: It was pretty cool for my four year old
customer_reviews.text: Took this to the park today to try it out. It was pretty cool for my four year old. He could easily reload it and do it himself. However, one of the rockets cracked. It was still useable but it makes me worry how long the others will last. I'm not entirely sure that it wasn't cracked out of the package. Something to be aware of.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great toy for all ages, boys and girls
customer_reviews.text: I bought stomp rockets for my twin boys when they were little (they are now 33) and I'm now buying them for their kids. My 8 year old granddaughter loved hers as well as my almost 4 year old grandson. The double version is wonderful for multiple kids to play with and keeps them busy for hours.
customer_reviews.author: Dana Spoonerow

customer_reviews.title: Great for Teens
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my 13 and 17 year-old-boys to use while we "shelter at home" and they really like it. They've used it a lot and it really does go up really high. I've even played with it myself :-) Good fun for the family.
customer_reviews.author: jflowe

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy and fun!
customer_reviews.text: Wow guys. My 2 and 5 year olds LOVE this! It's sturdy and fun! They both can use it at once. The rockets really do go super high too. The best part though. I left this outside for part of July and all of August in Missouri. The plastic didn't crack, didn't fade and is as good as new. High quality. Love it.
customer_reviews.author: Jenny Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Fun Toy
customer_reviews.text: Its easy to assemble. Fun gift for 4-8 year old, any gender. I even gifted this to someone who already had one and they were still excited to get it, as now they could compete "Whose rocket goes hight" with 4 friends!
customer_reviews.author: VBDoc

customer_reviews.title: Fun - kids can do it without help
customer_reviews.text: My 4 and 5 year old love these! They are easy for kids to play with without much -if any- parent help for setup and launch. Perfect! They didn’t go insanely high, but they did go higher than the trees near by. My kids played with them one evening and were able to attach glow sticks to them and launch them successfully. That was fun!
customer_reviews.author: Sarah

customer_reviews.title: but my 10 year old grandson and his 6 year old brother had fun with it
customer_reviews.text: It's kind of cheaply made, but my 10 year old grandson and his 6 year old brother had fun with it.
customer_reviews.author: Nica Nix

customer_reviews.title: Detaches every time
customer_reviews.text: Not sure about all of the 5 star reviews with no mention of the tubes detaching from the yellow stomp pads. Almost every time the kids stomp on the pads, the tubes detach from the pads since there's no way to tighten them together. I have to use duct tape to tape them together and make this work. Otherwise a fun toy to get them outside.
customer_reviews.author: Liccifruit

customer_reviews.title: Great bday gift
customer_reviews.text: This is my go to gifts for kids 5-9, I have gifted it at least 4 times and every kid loves it. I also buy extra arrows with it as the plastic on the arrows break after they hit the ground but it’s lots of fun!
customer_reviews.author: J. Richman

customer_reviews.title: These are cool...
customer_reviews.text: ...and my 6 year old enjoyed getting to walk across the roof to retrieve the one he shot up there. Games Rockets Competition Potentially falling off a roof. Honestly, no negatives.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: You’ll love it!!!
customer_reviews.text: This is an AMAZING and affordable gift!!! The rocket shoots 250 feet in the air and it really does!!! It goes so high! The kids were amazed! This is the perfect gift to get when your child gets invited to a bday party and you have no idea what to get them!
customer_reviews.author: Rheannond

customer_reviews.title: Fun toy for kids, not the best quality
customer_reviews.text: Initially liked this product as my children loved to use it. About an hour into the activity, two of the rockets broke “the plastic wings cracked off”. Disappointed with the quality as those pieces are no longer useable.
customer_reviews.author: HUSKYGOLFER

customer_reviews.title: Entertaining, no Really! It's Great!
customer_reviews.text: You would think that kids wouldn't be engaged with this non-tech game. I was so wrong. The kids, 7 & 2, had a ball with this game. They each tried their best to get the rockets higher than each other. This game is good for girls or boys. It took 2 minutes (if that) to assemble. The rockets are cushioned and doesn't hurt when they fall on your head. The rockets bounce when they hit the ground. It's actually pretty cool. Great outside game.
customer_reviews.author: C. Hughes

customer_reviews.title: 3 year old loves these!
customer_reviews.text: My 3 year old adores this!!! It doesn’t go very high when she stomps (she’s 30lbs), but if she sits on it like others recommended or we do it with her it goes really high! Make sure you have a wide open space to launch or they might end up on a roof!
customer_reviews.author: Lauren K Hansen

customer_reviews.title: This toy was a hit with the kids
customer_reviews.text: This was an absolute hit with the kids at our Easter celebration. I was concerned it might not hold up to 5 rough boys but it made it thru the day and my grandson was able to take it home for further enjoyment. I definitely recommend this for lots of fun outdoors
customer_reviews.author: dedra turner

customer_reviews.title: Great Fun for Kids
customer_reviews.text: My 3 year old, niece (8yr), and nephew (6yr) all had a blast with this. In a nutshell you're stomping on an air-filled plastic "pedal" that sends the air through a plastic tube and pushes a foam "rocket" into the air. Construction seemed a bit flimsy when we set it up but it works and everything is water proof (so great during a pool party) and simple enough for the kids to set up and operate on their own.
customer_reviews.author: Heathbar

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic
customer_reviews.text: These things are a blast! My children absolutely love them. They definitely go the advertised height. Only thing I would advise is not to push them all the way down on the base. Leave maybe an inch and a half or two inches of gap.
customer_reviews.author: The Lazer Ghost

customer_reviews.title: Isn’t sturdy & doesn’t sit flat, pieces don’t fit together & made very cheaply
customer_reviews.text: This product does not fit together well or sit flush to the ground. It doesn’t seem stable and is very hard to get the plastic pieces to fit together so I would like a refund! I bought a similar version of a different brand and it sits like a tripod and is very sturdy and works amazing. This version, not so much
customer_reviews.author: Keoc12

customer_reviews.title: Awesome awesome awesome toy !!!!! Must have !!!
customer_reviews.text: Awesome awesome awesome product!!!!!! My two boys love it !!! Got lots of compliments (from the in-laws too 😂😂😂 ) no but this product had them playing for hourssssss. Whipped out by bedtime so got some time with the misses 🙌🏼🙌🏼🙌🏼
customer_reviews.author: Francisco Chan

customer_reviews.title: Lots of Fun
customer_reviews.text: Love it. Hours of fun for kids and adults. More fun than I thought it would be. You do need a bit of space in your yard as it does tend to stray as it shoots up in the air especially on a windy day. Would highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: wishwatanabe

customer_reviews.title: Fun for all!!
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for our grandchildren's visit a few weeks ago and we all ( Children and adults) had lots of fun launching the rockets! I like having the two launchers in one! I liked them enough to have now purchased another for a gift!
customer_reviews.author: Deborah Dixon

customer_reviews.title: Fun Outdoor Toy- all ages
customer_reviews.text: It's a fun toy for all the kids on the street to play, and even the dads get into it. This version is much more stable stand than the version with just 1 rocket at a time so this version is much easier for younger kids (i.e. my 4 year old can do it easily).
customer_reviews.author: EJA

customer_reviews.title: Easy and simple fun
customer_reviews.text: Worth the $20 to toss your kids outside and burn some energy. Even my husband did a few jumps and it handled him fine.
customer_reviews.author: Jess H.

customer_reviews.title: Great Gift for Kids
customer_reviews.text: I just purchased a third one of these to give as a birthday present and the previous two times I gifted it the recepient loved it! These rockets are great for kids ages two and up-even adults get a kick out of playing with them!
customer_reviews.author: BMM

customer_reviews.title: Hours-Long Fun!
customer_reviews.text: A great toy for kids! My 6 3/4 and 4 1/4 -year old grandsons loved it and played with it for hours! I would definitely gift it and would recommend it! I have since purchased additional rockets, they re glow-in--the-dark one’s! Can’t wait until the boys see them!
customer_reviews.author: Frances Hill

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful 1st rocket toy :)
customer_reviews.text: I bought one if these for my grandson who turned 4 in august. He loved it! My other grandson who turned 4 in september loved it so much he asked for one as well so i ordered a 2nd one! Great quality. Hours and hours of fun.
customer_reviews.author: cindy Lockhart

customer_reviews.title: My 5 and 6 year old love these
customer_reviews.text: Bought these for my son's birthday party in the park. All the kids loved launching the rockets into the air. If you stick the rockets too far down it might get stuck and won't launch if the kids aren't strong or big enough. You just need to make sure the rockets are loose and can glide off easily and they'll fly high into the sky.
customer_reviews.author: Clark

customer_reviews.title: Fun gift!
customer_reviews.text: Who doesn't like stomp rockets? Purchased as a christmas gift for my 8yr old and it still gets used weekly!! Do be sure to allow amble room from trees and your home - these rockets fly HIGH! Remind kiddos to not lean over the rockets when someone is getting ready to launch. LOL!
customer_reviews.author: Sarah Lockerbie

customer_reviews.title: Not bad and lots of fun!
customer_reviews.text: The fins on the one rocket broke almost immediately. With that said it’s a super fun toy. The dart is still somewhat usable and my son is rather hard on his toys. I believe you can purchase additional rockets.
customer_reviews.author: Krista and Aaron

customer_reviews.title: Best toy of all!
customer_reviews.text: We originally purchased the single set for this toy but decided to buy the double set this year so that both kids had one. Of all their outdoor toys, this one gets played with the most. Lots of fun.
customer_reviews.author: Brickhouse

customer_reviews.title: A huge hit with my grandson!
customer_reviews.text: My grandson and I had way too much fun with these. As a side note, it says on the package that the rockets can shoot up to 200 feet. My grandson is pretty sure his rocket soared 201 feet. :)
customer_reviews.author: Jack H.

customer_reviews.title: Wanted it to stay together
customer_reviews.text: Seemed like a good product, but one of the pumps never stayed connected. Had to duck tape the yellow jump-on thing to the blue air tube for it to stay connected. Otherwise, I would have given at least a 4 star.
customer_reviews.author: Joyce H

customer_reviews.title: Fun Fun Fun!
customer_reviews.text: Gave to the grandkids for Christmas and they were a BIG hit, even with the parents (kids are 4 and 6 and the 4 year old is on the Autism spectrum). Super fun, got those kids moving out there, chasing these around and trying to catch them. You want the kids off the couch, playing together? You have to buy these for them!
customer_reviews.author: svsutej

customer_reviews.title: Broke after a couple of uses
customer_reviews.text: This was given to friends as a gift. I went over a few days after giving it to them and they said it already broke. I am sad to say this was not a quality product. I do not recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Jaimielaura

customer_reviews.title: Super fun toy
customer_reviews.text: love this toy but rockets are finicky on launch posts and don't always work. Also, the black tubes don't stay well on the base and the launchers are slanted but overall a super fun toy!
customer_reviews.author: Suzanne

customer_reviews.title: So much fun!!
customer_reviews.text: I got this for my great-niece's birthday and she had so much fun with it, I ordered another one for our grandkids. It was so easy to put together, our 5-year old did it himself. He and his 2-year old sister are able to make the rockets shoot. We have had so much fun with this toy, I recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Mamadee

customer_reviews.title: Very entertaining for all
customer_reviews.text: Kids (6 & 3) both loved it and have played with it every chance they have gotten since it was delivered. The rockets are a little flimsy so you will need to order a few more but they still operate even after being stepped on. Very happy with the purchase!
customer_reviews.author: D. Free

customer_reviews.title: FUN! Both my 2-year-old and my 10-year-old boys loved ...
customer_reviews.text: FUN! Both my 2-year-old and my 10-year-old boys loved it. One of the rockets had a loose "head" (the red part) and I fixed it with white glue. I also ordered spare rockets, so we can spend less time chasing them, and more time stomping! Good analog fun for the park or the beach. Be careful with trees!
customer_reviews.author: MJ808

customer_reviews.title: Stomp rocket
customer_reviews.text: Kids loved it buy extra middles they can get stuck in trees on roofs etc
customer_reviews.author: Cathy dahlstrom

customer_reviews.title: Love it! Going to buy more for gifts!
customer_reviews.text: Bought for my 4 year old’s birthday, so much fun! I especially love that there are two separate rocket launchers! Her and her 2 year old brother don’t fight when playing with this! Win win!
customer_reviews.author: Lauren Eichler

customer_reviews.title: Great Fun Kids can do with or without you.
customer_reviews.text: Love that is it easy to assemble and easy to use...even my special needs 10 year old grandson can stomp it and he is legally blind so he can see it too. 6 yr old granddaughter uses it with ease. We try to catch them. One person an even stomp both at the same time without an issue of falling. Great toy! My daughter is buying one for her house after she has seen mine.
customer_reviews.author: Nancy Lynn Maxwell

customer_reviews.title: Love this!  A Christmas favorite this year!
customer_reviews.text: This was definitely a favorite for Christmas this year! So glad we got this for the kids. They had great fun shooting the rockets and running around picking them up. Definitely gets some energy out! :) will buy again as gifts :)
customer_reviews.author: Kim

product_meta.title: The Original Stomp Rocket Dueling Rockets, 4 Rockets and Rocket Launcher - Outdoor Rocket Toy Gift for Boys and Girls Ages 6 Years and Up - Great for Outdoor Play with friends in the backyard & parks
product_meta.description: With Dueling Stomp Rocket, you can challenge your friends and family: The special Dueling Base lets two kids launch rockets at the same time, so you can see whose goes higher. Dueling Stomp Rocket is 100% KID powered! Run, jump and STOMP to launch these rockets up to 20 stories high -- that’s 200 feet in the air! Dueling Stomp Rocket is strong and durable, and great for active, outdoor play. Plus, it won the 2014 Preferred Choice Award from Creative Child Magazine. Includes 4 foam-tipped Ultra Stomp Rockets and the special Dueling Base featuring 2 Stomp Launch Pads. Refill rockets also available (item #20002). For kids ages 6 and up.
feature_bullets: Challenge your friends: This special Dueling Base lets 2 kids launch air rockets at the same time, so you can see whose goes higher! Great for year round fun to get kids away from screen time and play with outdoor toys.

100% KID powered: Run, jump and STOMP to launch these air rockets up to 20 stories high -- that's 200 feet in the air! These air rocket launchers are the perfect toddler toys for girls and boys ages 6 and up.

100% KID powered: Run, jump and STOMP to launch these air rockets up to 20 stories high -- that's 200 feet in the air! These air rocket launchers are the perfect toddler toys for girls and boys ages 6 and up.
Award-winning products from industry experts, including iParenting Media, Dr. Toy, and Creative Child Magazine.

Pair with Stomp Rocket Science book and get kids interested in STEM subjects (Science, Technology, Engineering, and Math) early. These toy rocket launchers are perfect STEM toys that are fun and get your kids up and moving while they learn.
